alert.note: Alert for Bandera; Dimmit; Edwards; Frio; Kerr; Kinney; Maverick; Medina; Real; Uvalde; Val Verde; Zavala (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 13 at 1:52PM CST until February 14 at 7:00PM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS OVER THE WINTER GARDEN AND SOUTHERN EDWARDS PLATEAU TUESDAY AFTERNOON... Very dry air will begin to filter into the region late Tuesday morning and afternoon due to gusty west winds. Minimum humidities in the 10 to 20 percent range, sustained 15 to 25 MPH winds with embedded higher gusts, and winter cured fuels will combine to create critical fire weather conditions from late morning through the early evening hours across this portion of south-central Texas tomorrow. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 7 PM CST TUESDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE WINTER GARDEN AND SOUTHERN EDWARDS PLATEAU... The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 11 AM to 7 PM CST Tuesday. * WINDS...West 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 11 percent. * IMPACTS...Any wildfires that develop could be difficult to control and will likely spread rapidly.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Bandera; Dimmit; Edwards; Frio; Kerr; Kinney; Maverick; Medina; Real; Uvalde; Val Verde; Zavala
